message: Also experimented with using Rocco for docs: http://help.github.com/code/email_reply_parser/
I quietly released the plaintext email reply parser we use at GitHub: https://github.com/github/email_reply_parser
It's far from a solved problem, so I'm interested in ideas on approaches people might have
For signatures, a decent approach is to find the last line with the senders name in it and strip everything after that
I thought that '-- ' was pretty well-established as the delimiter for plaintext email signatures? (Following Usenet conventions I suppose http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1849#section-4.3.2)
I hear real users use RFC standards all the time
@kneath I'm a real user. I used it. That said, yeah, point taken.
